meanings.definition: Suitable for or characteristic of reading.
meanings.sent1: The book had a readerly cover that attracted many bookworms.
meanings.sent2: She preferred readerly novels over complex philosophical texts.
meanings.sent3: The library's cozy atmosphere made it a readerly paradise.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a readerly quality that drew listeners in like a good book.
meanings.sent5: The font size and spacing of the text made it very readerly for all ages.

meanings.definition: Inclined to read or enjoy reading.
meanings.sent1: As a readerly person, he always had a book in hand.
meanings.sent2: She was so readerly that she finished a novel in one sitting.
meanings.sent3: His readerly nature led him to spend hours in the bookstore.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with readerly excitement when she entered the library.
meanings.sent5: The book club attracted many readerly individuals who shared a love for stories.

meanings.sent1: The author's readerly writing style made complex topics accessible.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were so readerly that even a child could follow them.
meanings.sent3: The readerly manual helped him assemble the furniture without any confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation was so readerly that everyone grasped the concept immediately.
meanings.sent5: The story's readerly plot twists kept the audience engaged till the end.
